title: Trump Raised $139 Million In July, Has $327 Million Cash On Hand
content: Republican presidential nominee and former president Donald Trump has said that his campaign raised USD 139 million in July and has USD 327 million cash on hand.
summary: Republican presidential nominee and former president Donald Trump has said that his campaign raised USD 139 million in July and has USD 327 million cash on hand.

title: Who Is Vadim Krasikov, The Assassin Freed In Russian Prisoner Swap
content: Vadim Krasikov, a Russian freed from jail in Germany on Friday in a prisoner swap between Moscow and the West, was convicted of the murder in 2019 of a former Chechen militant as he walked in broad daylight in a park in central Berlin.
summary: Vadim Krasikov, a Russian freed from jail in Germany on Friday in a prisoner swap between Moscow and the West, was convicted of the murder in 2019 of a former Chechen militant as he walked in broad daylight in a park in central Berlin.

title: 2 Indians Arrested With Drugs Worth $10 Million In US
content: US officials have arrested two Indian nationals with drugs worth USD 10 million, the Department of Justice said.
summary: US officials have arrested two Indian nationals with drugs worth USD 10 million, the Department of Justice said.

title: Intel Says It Will Sack 18,000 Staff, Cut $20 Billion In Expenses
content: US chip maker Intel said Thursday it will slash more than 15 percent of its workforce as it streamlines operations.The plan to cut approximately $20 billion in expenses this year came as Intel reported a loss of $1.6 billion in the recently ended qua
summary: US chip maker Intel said Thursday it will slash more than 15 percent of its workforce as it streamlines operations.The plan to cut approximately $20 billion in expenses this year came as Intel reported a loss of $1.6 billion in the recently ended qua

title: Biden Says US Committed To Defend Israel Against "All Threats From Iran"
content: US President Joe Biden told Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday that Washington is committed to defending Israel's security "against all threats from Iran," the White House said, after the assassination of a top Hamas leader in Tehran.
summary: US President Joe Biden told Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday that Washington is committed to defending Israel's security "against all threats from Iran," the White House said, after the assassination of a top Hamas leader in Tehran.

title: "Will Attack In Return": Netanyahu Warns As Iran, Hezbollah Vow Revenge
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday that Israel was prepared for any "aggression" against it following threats of retaliation for the killings of top Hamas and Hezbollah figures.
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday that Israel was prepared for any "aggression" against it following threats of retaliation for the killings of top Hamas and Hezbollah figures.

title: Putin Meets Freed Russian Prisoners At Moscow Airport
content: President Vladimir Putin late on Thursday met Russian citizens, who were detained in foreign countries and returned to their homeland after a prisoners' exchange deal, at Vnukovo Airport here.
summary: President Vladimir Putin late on Thursday met Russian citizens, who were detained in foreign countries and returned to their homeland after a prisoners' exchange deal, at Vnukovo Airport here.

title: 5.0 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Italy, No Immediate Damage: Officials
content: A 5.0-magnitude earthquake struck Italy's southern region of Calabria late Friday, but there were no immediate reports of damage.
summary: A 5.0-magnitude earthquake struck Italy's southern region of Calabria late Friday, but there were no immediate reports of damage.

title: Hezbollah Says It Fired Dozens Of Rockets At Israel Amid Rising Tensions
content: Hezbollah said it launched rockets at northern Israel Thursday "in response" to a deadly Israeli strike in south Lebanon -- the group's first attack after Israel killed a top commander earlier this week.
summary: Hezbollah said it launched rockets at northern Israel Thursday "in response" to a deadly Israeli strike in south Lebanon -- the group's first attack after Israel killed a top commander earlier this week.

title: Yemen's Houthi Rebels Vow "Military Response" To Israel Escalation
content: The leader of Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels vowed a "military response" Thursday to the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran in an attack blamed on Israel.
summary: The leader of Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels vowed a "military response" Thursday to the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran in an attack blamed on Israel.

title: Netanyahu, Biden To Hold Call Today After Hamas Chief's Killing
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and U.S. President Joe Biden will speak by phone on Thursday, the White House said, following the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, the Iranian capital, earlier this week.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and U.S. President Joe Biden will speak by phone on Thursday, the White House said, following the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, the Iranian capital, earlier this week.

title: Assassin, Journalist, Critic: Who Were Freed In Russia-West Prisoner Swap
content: Russia and the West have released a total of 24 prisoners in the biggest exchange since the end of the Cold War, officials said on Thursday.
summary: Russia and the West have released a total of 24 prisoners in the biggest exchange since the end of the Cold War, officials said on Thursday.

title: Trump Loses Appeal Of Gag Order In Hush Money Criminal Case
content: A New York state appeals court on Thursday rejected Donald Trump's challenge to a gag order in his hush money criminal case, where the former US president was convicted in May on charges stemming from hush money paid to a porn star.
summary: A New York state appeals court on Thursday rejected Donald Trump's challenge to a gag order in his hush money criminal case, where the former US president was convicted in May on charges stemming from hush money paid to a porn star.

title: Explained: Women's Boxing Match At Paris Olympics Sparks Gender Row
content: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif, who failed a gender eligibility test last year, knocked their Italian opponent out in 46 seconds in the 66 kg women's boxing category and has drawn the ire of Italian Prime Minister Georgia Meloni.
summary: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif, who failed a gender eligibility test last year, knocked their Italian opponent out in 46 seconds in the 66 kg women's boxing category and has drawn the ire of Italian Prime Minister Georgia Meloni.

title: As India, Vietnam Strengthen Ties, PM Modi Speaks Against "Expansionism"
content: India, Vietnam adopted an action plan to expand strategic ties with PM Modi vowing to work jointly for a rules-based Indo-Pacific and asserting that New Delhi supports development and "not expansionism" in remarks that came amid concerns over China.
summary: India, Vietnam adopted an action plan to expand strategic ties with PM Modi vowing to work jointly for a rules-based Indo-Pacific and asserting that New Delhi supports development and "not expansionism" in remarks that came amid concerns over China.

title: Russia Frees US Reporter In Major Prisoner Swap With West, Says Turkey
content: US journalist Evan Gershkovich and former US marine Paul Whelan are expected to be released by Russia as part of one of the biggest East-West prisoner swaps since the Cold War, according to US media Thursday.
summary: US journalist Evan Gershkovich and former US marine Paul Whelan are expected to be released by Russia as part of one of the biggest East-West prisoner swaps since the Cold War, according to US media Thursday.

title: 10 Key Moments In Israel-Hamas War
content: After members of the Palestinian militant group Hamas carried out the worst attack in Israeli history, on October 7, 2023, Israel responded with a devastating military campaign in the Gaza Strip.
summary: After members of the Palestinian militant group Hamas carried out the worst attack in Israeli history, on October 7, 2023, Israel responded with a devastating military campaign in the Gaza Strip.

title: Amazon Set To Join Big Tech's Spending Surge As AI Race Heats Up
content: As a result of the spending increase, Amazon's gross profit margin growth is expected to have slowed to 1.3% in the April-June quarter, compared with 2.6% in the previous quarter and an average of 2.7% over the past two years.
summary: As a result of the spending increase, Amazon's gross profit margin growth is expected to have slowed to 1.3% in the April-June quarter, compared with 2.6% in the previous quarter and an average of 2.7% over the past two years.

title: Japan To Now Hunt Second-Largest Whale Species
content: Japan has expanded its commercial whaling to include fin whales, the second-largest animal species on the planet, a decision criticised by Australia's government on Thursday.
summary: Japan has expanded its commercial whaling to include fin whales, the second-largest animal species on the planet, a decision criticised by Australia's government on Thursday.

title: 30 Killed, 35 Missing After Torrential Rains In China: Report
content: At least 30 people are dead and 35 are missing in central China, state media reported Thursday, following days of torrential rain that lashed the country earlier this week.
summary: At least 30 people are dead and 35 are missing in central China, state media reported Thursday, following days of torrential rain that lashed the country earlier this week.
